name: Hydra Research FDM Printer Base Description

prime_tower_line_width.label: Prime Tower Line Width
prime_tower_line_width.description: Width of a single prime tower line.

xy_offset_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Horizontal Expansion
xy_offset_layer_0.description: Amount of offset applied to all polygons in the first layer. A negative value can compensate for squishing of the first layer known as "elephant's foot".

top_bottom_pattern.label: Top/Bottom Pattern
top_bottom_pattern.description: The pattern of the top/bottom layers.

skin_outline_count.label: Extra Skin Wall Count
skin_outline_count.description: Replaces the outermost part of the top/bottom pattern with a number of concentric lines. Using one or two lines improves roofs that start on infill material.
skin_outline_count.value: 0 if top_bottom_pattern == 'concentric' and top_bottom_pattern_0 == 'concentric' and roofing_layer_count <= 0 else 0
skin_outline_count.enabled: (top_layers > 0 or bottom_layers > 0) and (top_bottom_pattern != 'concentric' or top_bottom_pattern_0 != 'concentric' or (roofing_layer_count > 0 and roofing_pattern != 'concentric'))

skin_overlap.label: Skin Overlap Percentage
skin_overlap.description: Adjust the amount of overlap between the walls and (the endpoints of) the skin-centerlines, as a percentage of the line widths of the skin lines and the innermost wall. A slight overlap allows the walls to connect firmly to the skin. Note that, given an equal skin and wall line-width, any percentage over 50% may already cause any skin to go past the wall, because at that point the position of the nozzle of the skin-extruder may already reach past the middle of the wall.

infill_pattern.label: Infill Pattern
infill_pattern.description: The pattern of the infill material of the print. The line and zig zag infill swap direction on alternate layers, reducing material cost. The grid, triangle, tri-hexagon, cubic, octet, quarter cubic, cross and concentric patterns are fully printed every layer. Gyroid, cubic, quarter cubic and octet infill change with every layer to provide a more equal distribution of strength over each direction.

infill_sparse_thickness.label: Infill Layer Thickness
infill_sparse_thickness.description: The thickness per layer of infill material. This value should always be a multiple of the layer height and is otherwise rounded.
infill_sparse_thickness.value: resolveOrValue('layer_height') if not infill_support_layer_height_optimization_enable else resolveOrValue('layer_height') * 2 if 3 > math.floor((machine_nozzle_size * 0.75)/resolveOrValue('layer_height')) > 1.9 else resolveOrValue('layer_height') * 3 if math.floor((machine_nozzle_size * 0.75)/resolveOrValue('layer_height')) > 2.9 else resolveOrValue('layer_height')

roofing_material_flow.label: Top Surface Skin Flow
roofing_material_flow.description: Flow compensation on lines of the areas at the top of the print.

support_interface_material_flow.label: Support Interface Flow
support_interface_material_flow.description: Flow compensation on lines of support roof or floor.
support_interface_material_flow.value: material_flow - 0 if layer_height > machine_nozzle_size * 0.38 else material_flow - 0

support_roof_material_flow.label: Support Roof Flow
support_roof_material_flow.description: Flow compensation on support roof lines.

support_bottom_material_flow.label: Support Floor Flow
support_bottom_material_flow.description: Flow compensation on support floor lines.

material_flow_layer_0.label: Initial Layer Flow
material_flow_layer_0.description: Flow compensation for the first layer: the amount of material extruded on the initial layer is multiplied by this value.

speed_prime_tower.label: Prime Tower Speed
speed_prime_tower.description: The speed at which the prime tower is printed. Printing the prime tower slower can make it more stable when the adhesion between the different filaments is suboptimal.

cool_fan_speed_max.label: Maximum Fan Speed
cool_fan_speed_max.description: The speed at which the fans spin on the minimum layer time. The fan speed gradually increases between the regular fan speed and maximum fan speed when the threshold is hit.

cool_min_layer_time.label: Minimum Layer Time
cool_min_layer_time.description: The minimum time spent in a layer. This forces the printer to slow down, to at least spend the time set here in one layer. This allows the printed material to cool down properly before printing the next layer. Layers may still take shorter than the minimal layer time if Lift Head is disabled and if the Minimum Speed would otherwise be violated.

support_brim_width.label: Support Brim Width
support_brim_width.description: The width of the brim to print underneath the support. A larger brim enhances adhesion to the build plate, at the cost of some extra material.

support_z_distance.label: Support Z Distance
support_z_distance.description: Distance from the top/bottom of the support structure to the print. This gap provides clearance to remove the supports after the model is printed. This value is rounded up to a multiple of the layer height.

support_xy_distance.label: Support X/Y Distance
support_xy_distance.description: Distance of the support structure from the print in the X/Y directions.

support_xy_distance_overhang.label: Minimum Support X/Y Distance
support_xy_distance_overhang.description: Distance of the support structure from the overhang in the X/Y directions.

support_offset.label: Support Horizontal Expansion
support_offset.description: Amount of offset applied to all support polygons in each layer. Positive values can smooth out the support areas and result in more sturdy support.

support_infill_sparse_thickness.label: Support Infill Layer Thickness
support_infill_sparse_thickness.description: The thickness per layer of support infill material. This value should always be a multiple of the layer height and is otherwise rounded.
support_infill_sparse_thickness.value: resolveOrValue('layer_height') if not infill_support_layer_height_optimization_enable else resolveOrValue('layer_height') * 2 if 2.9 > math.floor((machine_nozzle_size * 0.75)/resolveOrValue('layer_height')) > 1.9 else resolveOrValue('layer_height') * 3 if math.floor((machine_nozzle_size * 0.75)/resolveOrValue('layer_height')) > 2.9 else resolveOrValue('layer_height')

gradual_support_infill_step_height.label: Gradual Support Infill Step Height
gradual_support_infill_step_height.description: The height of support infill of a given density before switching to half the density.
gradual_support_infill_step_height.enabled: (support_enable or support_meshes_present) and support_infill_rate > 0 and gradual_support_infill_steps > 0

minimum_support_area.label: Minimum Support Area
minimum_support_area.description: Minimum area size for support polygons. Polygons which have an area smaller than this value will not be generated.

support_interface_height.label: Support Interface Thickness
support_interface_height.description: The thickness of the interface of the support where it touches with the model on the bottom or the top.

support_roof_height.label: Support Roof Thickness
support_roof_height.description: The thickness of the support roofs. This controls the amount of dense layers at the top of the support on which the model rests.

support_bottom_height.label: Support Floor Thickness
support_bottom_height.description: The thickness of the support floors. This controls the number of dense layers that are printed on top of places of a model on which support rests.

support_interface_density.label: Support Interface Density
support_interface_density.description: Adjusts the density of the roofs and floors of the support structure. A higher value results in better overhangs, but the supports are harder to remove.

support_bottom_density.label: Support Floor Density
support_bottom_density.description: The density of the floors of the support structure. A higher value results in better adhesion of the support on top of the model.
support_bottom_density.value: extruderValue(support_bottom_extruder_nr, 'support_interface_density') / 2 if support_interface_density / 2 > support_infill_rate else support_infill_rate

minimum_interface_area.label: Minimum Support Interface Area
minimum_interface_area.description: Minimum area size for support interface polygons. Polygons which have an area smaller than this value will be printed as normal support.

support_interface_offset.label: Support Interface Horizontal Expansion
support_interface_offset.description: Amount of offset applied to the support interface polygons.

prime_tower_size.label: Prime Tower Size
prime_tower_size.description: The width of the prime tower.

prime_tower_min_volume.label: Prime Tower Minimum Volume
prime_tower_min_volume.description: The minimum volume for each layer of the prime tower in order to purge enough material.
prime_tower_min_volume.value: (2 * 3.14 * (prime_tower_size - (2 * prime_tower_line_width)) * prime_tower_line_width * layer_height) if (2 * 3.14 * (prime_tower_size - (2 * prime_tower_line_width)) * prime_tower_line_width * layer_height) > 6 else 6

switch_extruder_retraction_speeds.label: Nozzle Switch Retraction Speed
switch_extruder_retraction_speeds.description: The speed at which the filament is retracted. A higher retraction speed works better, but a very high retraction speed can lead to filament grinding.

switch_extruder_extra_prime_amount.label: Nozzle Switch Extra Prime Amount
switch_extruder_extra_prime_amount.description: Extra material to prime after nozzle switching.

support_skip_some_zags.label: Break Up Support In Chunks
support_skip_some_zags.description: Skip some support line connections to make the support structure easier to break away. This setting is applicable to the Zig Zag support infill pattern.

support_conical_angle.label: Conical Support Angle
support_conical_angle.description: The angle of the tilt of conical support. With 0 degrees being vertical, and 90 degrees being horizontal. Smaller angles cause the support to be more sturdy, but consist of more material. Negative angles cause the base of the support to be wider than the top.

bridge_settings_enabled.label: Enable Bridge Settings
bridge_settings_enabled.description: Detect bridges and modify print speed, flow and fan settings while bridges are printed.

bridge_wall_min_length.label: Minimum Bridge Wall Length
bridge_wall_min_length.description: Unsupported walls shorter than this will be printed using the normal wall settings. Longer unsupported walls will be printed using the bridge wall settings.

bridge_skin_support_threshold.label: Bridge Skin Support Threshold
bridge_skin_support_threshold.description: If a skin region is supported for less than this percentage of its area, print it using the bridge settings. Otherwise it is printed using the normal skin settings.

bridge_sparse_infill_max_density.label: Bridge Sparse Infill Max Density
bridge_sparse_infill_max_density.description: Maximum density of infill considered to be sparse. Skin over sparse infill is considered to be unsupported and so may be treated as a bridge skin.

bridge_wall_coast.label: Bridge Wall Coasting
bridge_wall_coast.description: This controls the distance the extruder should coast immediately before a bridge wall begins. Coasting before the bridge starts can reduce the pressure in the nozzle and may produce a flatter bridge.

bridge_wall_material_flow.label: Bridge Wall Flow
bridge_wall_material_flow.description: When printing bridge walls, the amount of material extruded is multiplied by this value.

bridge_skin_material_flow.label: Bridge Skin Flow
bridge_skin_material_flow.description: When printing bridge skin regions, the amount of material extruded is multiplied by this value.

bridge_skin_density_2.label: Bridge Second Skin Density
bridge_skin_density_2.description: The density of the second bridge skin layer. Values less than 100 will increase the gaps between the skin lines.

bridge_skin_material_flow_3.label: Bridge Third Skin Flow
bridge_skin_material_flow_3.description: When printing the third bridge skin layer, the amount of material extruded is multiplied by this value.

bridge_skin_density_3.label: Bridge Third Skin Density
bridge_skin_density_3.description: The density of the third bridge skin layer. Values less than 100 will increase the gaps between the skin lines.

infill_support_layer_height_optimization.label: Optimize Infill/Support Layer Height
infill_support_layer_height_optimization.description: Enableling this generates infill and support infill at 2-3 times the layer hieght if possible. This can significantly decrease print times for low layer height jobs.

infill_pattern_base.label: Infill Pattern Base
infill_pattern_base.description: The infill pattern to be used if infill percentage less than 65%

tool_material_print_temperature_offset.label: Tool Printing Temperature Offset
tool_material_print_temperature_offset.description: The printing tmeperature offset from the defualt printing tempertaure to compensate for the nozzle material of the tool

material_bed_probe_temperature.label: Heat Bed Probing Temperature
material_bed_probe_temperature.description: A temperature close to the bed temperature during printing to account for thermal expansion of the bed when probing.

part_removal_temperature_enable.label: Part Removal Temperature Enable
part_removal_temperature_enable.description: Enable or disbale material part removale temperature notifactions at the end of a print job.

material_part_removal_temperature.label: Part Removal Temperature
material_part_removal_temperature.description: The ideal bed temperature to remove the part after printing.

speed_volumetric_max.label: Maximum Volumetric Speed
speed_volumetric_max.description: Maximum volumetric speed allowed for this material. Limits the maximum printing speed to the maximum material volumetric speed.

speed_volumetric_min.label: Minimum Volumetric Speed
speed_volumetric_min.description: Minimum volumetric speed allowed for this material. Limits the minimum printing speed to the minimum material volumetric speed.

pressure_advance_value.label: Pressure Advance Value
pressure_advance_value.description: Pressure advance aims to compensate for the elasticity of the filament and the extruder system. Every material will require a slightly different value. Values between 0.01 and 0.1 are recommended for most rigid materials, try a higher value for flexible materials. Calibrated for 0.4mm diameter nozzle and 0.2mm layers

pressure_advance_value_calculated.label: Pressure Advance Calculated Value
pressure_advance_value_calculated.description: Pressure advance calculated value aims to volumetrically calculate pressure advance values based on layer height and nozzle diameter. This assumes that the Pressure Advance Value is calibrated for 0.4mm diameter nozzle and 0.2mm layers.

material_name.label: Material Name
material_name.description: Name of material, used for gcode output metadata

material_print_surface.label: Recommended Print Surface
material_print_surface.description: Recommended Print Surface for this material. Used for gcode output metadata.

speed_print_max.label: Maximum Print Speed
speed_print_max.description: Maximum allowed print speed. This is overriden if Maximum Volumetric Speed is lower than the Maximum Print Speed.

speed_print_factor.label: Print Speed Factor
speed_print_factor.description: This factor adjusts the defualt print speed (all speeds except perimeter speeds). 1 = default speeds.

speed_perimeter_factor.label: Perimeter Speed Factor
speed_perimeter_factor.description: This factor adjusts the defualt perimeter print speed. 1 = default speeds.

support_z_distance_ratio.label: Support Z Distance Ratio
support_z_distance_ratio.description: The ratio between layer height and nozzle diameter expressed as a percentage below which the support z distance will be increased to double the layer height rather than just the layer height
